info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 7 at 11:03AM EDT until April 7 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following county, Greenville.
* WHEN...Until 100 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1057 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that rain had ended across the advised area. Many locations across greater Greenville has received 2 to 2.5 inches of rain this morning. Locally excessive runoff will continue throughout the the Reedy and Brushy Creek basins. Remain wary of standing water and flooded intersections in the city of Greenville. The Reedy River gage may crest around 9.5 feet which typically results in flooding of parts of the Swamp Rabbit Trail and Cleveland Park. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greenville Downtown, Greenville Eastside, West Greenville, Mauldin, Taylors, Simpsonville, Berea, Five Forks, Welcome, Donaldson Center, Cherrydale Point and Paris Mountain State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads!

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
